intro: Cassia racemosa, commonly known as the clustered cassia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces bright yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Cassia racemosa thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along roadsides.
